conclusion: The incident beam enters the prism normally to face AD.
The beam travels straight to the first sloping surface AB without deviation.
At AB, the angle between the incident ray inside the glass and the normal to AB is 30°.
Critical angle calculation: sin θ_c = 1/n = 1/√2 ⇒ θ_c = 45°.
Comparison of angle of incidence i = 30° < θ_c (45°), so the ray refracts out of the prism at AB.
Applying Snell’s law at AB: √2 sin 30° = sin r, leading to r = 45°.
The emergent ray leaves face AB in the glass-to-air direction that makes 45° with the normal to AB.
